title: Mirrors - convex or concave - large real image

content.question: An object is located in front of a spherical mirror. The image formed by the mirror is also located in front of the mirror and is larger in size than the object. Is the mirror concave or convex? What evidence supports the claim?

choices.label: Concave. The image is a virtual image.
Concave. The image is on the same side of the mirror as the object.
Convex. The image is a real image.
Convex. The image is larger in size than the object.

content.answer: Concave. The image is on the same side of the mirror as the object.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
